title: Aishwarya Nadimpally
text:
Hi, I’m Aishwarya Nadimpally, a Data Scientist with a passion for deriving insights that help businesses and consumers.

Learn more about me

title: About
text: I’m currently completing my Master’s degree in Data Science at the University of British Columbia, working on a Capstone project with Rio Tinto.

title: Projects
text:
Description: Performed customer segmentation using K-means clustering to help a retail client identify target customer groups. This project involved data cleaning, feature engineering, and model evaluation to ensure the best results.
Technologies Used: Python, SQL, Excel

title: Projects
text:
Job Search Application

Description: Developed a job search application using Google Generative AI to simplify the job search process. The application provides custom matching scores, identifies missing skills, and includes job application links based on each uploaded resume.
Technologies Used: Python, Google Generative AI, Streamlit
Link: GitHub Repository
Images:

title: Projects
text:
Real-Time Data Pipeline

Description: Created a real-time data pipeline to process and analyze streaming data from IoT devices. The project involved setting up data ingestion using Kafka, real-time processing with Spark Streaming, and visualization using Power BI.
Technologies Used: Python, SQL, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Power BI
Link: GitHub Repository
Images:

title: Projects
text:
A/B Testing Dashboard

Description: Designed and developed an interactive dashboard to visualize A/B test results for an e-commerce website. The dashboard provides insights into user behavior and helps in making data-driven decisions.
Technologies Used: Python, SQL, Looker, Tableau
Link: GitHub Repository
Images:

title: Projects
text:
Predictive Maintenance System

Description: Implemented a predictive maintenance system for a manufacturing company to predict equipment failures before they occur. This project involved data collection, feature selection, model training, and deployment using AWS.
Technologies Used: Python, SQL, AWS
Link: GitHub Repository
